title.value: Воздействие свинца, никеля и цинка на рост и репродукцию большого прудовика (Lymnaea stagnalis)
Lead, nickel and zinc impacts on the growth and reproduction of the pond snail (Lymnaea stagnalis)

journal.title: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of Belarus. Biological Series

person.name: Dromashko, S.E., National Academy of Sciences (Belarus). Institute of Genetics and Cytology

abstract.value: The impacts of 0.003-0.03 mg/l Pb2+, 0.025-0.75 mg/l Ni2+ and 0.01-0.1 mg/l Zn2+ chronic exposure on growth, reproduction and the organization of Lymnaea stagnalis egg capsules are investigated. It is found that fecundity has decreased in a dose-dependent manner as a result of chronic exposure to zinc and nickel. At the same time a slight growth and fecundity stimulation as a result of chronic exposure to 0.003-0.03 mg/l Pb2+ is revealed. The frequency of abnormal egg capsules (with abnormalities in the structure and the number of embryos) has increased significantly as a result of the exposure to the highest metals concentrations. These data suggest that an increase in the frequency of abnormalities in egg capsules structure and deviations the number of embryos per egg capsule of Lymnaea stagnalis can be used as a sensitive tool for metal-containing sewage biotesting.
